title: Comprehensive Social Protection Coverage
description: In 2021, Bolivia achieved a remarkable 96.94% coverage of social protection and labor programs, ensuring a safety net for nearly the entire population.

title: Extensive Social Safety Net for the Poorest
description: Bolivia's social safety net programs covered 99.34% of the poorest quintile in 2021, demonstrating a strong commitment to supporting its most vulnerable citizens.

title: High Coverage of Social Safety Nets
description: In 2021, Bolivia's social safety net programs reached 96.80% of the population, providing widespread support across various income levels.

title: Significant Child Labor Hours
description: In 2015, Bolivian children aged 7-14 worked an average of 23.44 hours per week, indicating a high prevalence of child labor in the country.

title: Low Adequacy of Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2019, unemployment benefits and active labor market programs in Bolivia accounted for only 1.20% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, highlighting a need for improvement.
